'''Prince Rogers Nelson''' (born June 7, 1958), better known as '''Prince''', is an American singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. He has been known under the [[Love Symbol Album|unpronounceable symbol]] ([[File:Prince logo.svg|12px]]), which he used between 1993 and 2000. During that period he was frequently referred to in the media as "'''The Artist Formerly Known as Prince'''", often abbreviated to "'''TAFKAP'''", or simply "'''The Artist'''".<ref>{{cite web|last=Bucklin |first=Arden |url=http://www.powells.com/cgi-bin/biblio?inkey=2-155972448x-1 |title=Purple Reign: The Artist Formerly Known as Prince by â Powell's Books |publisher=Powells.com |accessdate=August 4, 2010}}</ref>
+
'''Prince Rogers Nelson''' (born June 7, 1958), better known as '''Prince''', is an American singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. He has been known under the [[Love Symbol Album|unpronounceable symbol]], which he used between 1993 and 2000. During that period he was frequently referred to in the media as "'''The Artist Formerly Known as Prince'''", often abbreviated to "'''TAFKAP'''", or simply "'''The Artist'''".<ref>{{cite web|last=Bucklin |first=Arden |url=http://www.powells.com/cgi-bin/biblio?inkey=2-155972448x-1 |title=Purple Reign: The Artist Formerly Known as Prince by â Powell's Books |publisher=Powells.com |accessdate=August 4, 2010}}</ref>
Prince has so far produced ten platinum albums and thirty Top 40 singles during his career, to date.<ref name="books.google.com">{{Cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=vGJ7XmA8rjIC&pg=PA243&dq=formerly+known+as+Prince#v=onepage&q=formerly%20known%20as%20Prince&f=false |title=History of Rock and Roll, Thomas Larsen, page 243 |publisher=Google Books |accessdate=March 18, 2010}}</ref> Prince founded his own recording studio and label; writing, self-producing and playing most, or all, of the instruments on his recordings.<ref name="books.google.com"/> In addition, Prince has been a "talent promoter" for the careers of [[Sheila E.]], [[Carmen Electra]], [[The Time (band)|The Time]] and [[Vanity 6]],<ref name="books.google.com"/> and has written songs for these artists and others (including [[Chaka Khan]], [[The Bangles]], and [[SinÃ©ad O'Connor]]).
Prince has so far produced ten platinum albums and thirty Top 40 singles during his career, to date.<ref name="books.google.com">{{Cite book|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=vGJ7XmA8rjIC&pg=PA243&dq=formerly+known+as+Prince#v=onepage&q=formerly%20known%20as%20Prince&f=false |title=History of Rock and Roll, Thomas Larsen, page 243 |publisher=Google Books |accessdate=March 18, 2010}}</ref> Prince founded his own recording studio and label; writing, self-producing and playing most, or all, of the instruments on his recordings.<ref name="books.google.com"/> In addition, Prince has been a "talent promoter" for the careers of [[Sheila E.]], [[Carmen Electra]], [[The Time (band)|The Time]] and [[Vanity 6]],<ref name="books.google.com"/> and has written songs for these artists and others (including [[Chaka Khan]], [[The Bangles]], and [[SinÃ©ad O'Connor]]).
